results.title: Co-operative farming in East Germany
results.brief_description: Describes co-operative farming in East Germany, illustrates patterns of family and village life and provides economic and social insights into communal living. Includes scenes of potato harvesting, dairy farming and the activities of the Communist Party organisation - the Free German Youth.
results.description: Describes co-operative farming in East Germany, illustrates patterns of family and village life and provides economic and social insights into communal living. Includes scenes of potato harvesting, dairy farming and the activities of the Communist Party organisation - the Free German Youth.

results.title: Co-op housing: the best move we ever made
results.creator_credit: Laura Sky, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
The film explores the dimensions of the housing crisis in Canada, the definition of cooperative housing, and its possibilities as described by some of the people who are living in such dwellings today. Here, housing is owned and operated by people as users, not as investors. The film emphasizes an alternative in housing: security of tenure and mutual aid as the owner-families have come to value them.

results.title: Co-op housing: getting it together
results.creator_credit: Laura Sky, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
People, housing, funds and expertise: getting them together isn’t easy, but it can be done. The film deals with the planning and procedures involved in setting up a co-op, whether that means building one, or buying and rehabilitating existing housing. People living in different kinds of co-ops talk about them, and how they function.

results.title: Cooma: gateway to the Snowy Mountains
results.creator_credit: George I. Malcolm and Cooma Municipal Council
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist attractions of Cooma in New South Wales. Includes fishing for trout, hiking, the scenic Snowy Mountains, hydro-electric undertakings, and the wonderful snow fields within easy reach of the town.

results.title: The Cooling system and fuel system
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Automobile Maintenance”.
Demonstrates how to check for leaks in the cooling system; check the fan and water pump; mechanical operation of the carburettor; filters and vents; and fuel pumps.

results.title: Cooks in clover
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Film Workshop and Gas Council
results.brief_description: Traces the regional origins of traditional British food, and shows how anyone interested in cooking can recreate the sumptuous fare of the past by the use of modern techniques in cooking. Demonstrates how to obtain perfect results when preparing Dover Sole, Melton Mowbray Pork Pie and the Roast Beef of Old England with comparative ease.

results.title: Cooking kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “People of the Australian western desert (A)”.
A Pintubi man prepares and cooks a red kangaroo and divides it among his family. (Some scenes may offend animal rights supporters).

results.title: Cooking in liquids
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Film Workshop and Gas Council
results.brief_description: Of interest to anyone who likes to cook, particularly beginners. This film shows the right temperature for boiling; a time-saving stew needing no preliminary frying; spaghetti hints; a marinade for tenderising; finally, an invitation to be experimental in the kitchen.

results.title: Australian Aborigines: cooking
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the University of Sydney’s expedition to Arnhem Land, this film shows the traditional methods the local people use to cook food.

results.title: A Conversation with Jawaharlal Nehru and Chester Bowles
results.creator_credit: Robert D. Graff and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: The Prime Minister of India, statesman and leader of the awakening nations of Asia - discusses his career and world events with Chester Bowles, former US Ambassador to India. He describes his early life, his friendship with Gandhi, and the fight for freedom. he also expresses his views on the problems India was facing in the 1960’s.
results.title_for_label: A Conversation with Jawaharlal Nehru and Chester Bowles
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert D. Graff and National Broadcasting Company
